Kidney cancer cases to double by 2050: 5 warning signs you should not ignore
description: Kidney cancer cases are projected to double globally by 2050, primarily due to preventable factors like obesity, smoking, and lack of exercise, a new study reveals. Researchers from Fox Chase Cancer Center emphasize that over half of cases stem from modifiable lifestyle choices.  Early detection is crucial, as many dismiss warning signs. Prevention include lifestyle changes such as weight control, blood pressure, blood sugar management, and smoking cessation can significantly lower the risk, and prevent cancer.

Despite his personal tragedy, Wellalage played, while India secured a thrilling Super Over victory against Sri Lanka, setting up a final clash with archrival Pakistan.

'For economic security': Trump admin mulls chip-based tariffs on foreign electronics
description: The Trump administration is reportedly planning new tariffs on imported electronics, based on their chip content, to boost US manufacturing. This move could impose a 25% rate on chip value, potentially raising costs for American consumers and worsening inflation. Major chipmakers like TSMC and Samsung might face significant impact, as the policy aims to reshore critical production.

title: U.S. House Democrats release Epstein schedules showing plans to meet Elon Musk, Peter Thiel
description: The documents, which Democrats on the House Oversight Committee said came from Epstein's estate in response to a congressional subpoena, also showed Britain's Prince Andrew flew on Epstein's private jet in 2000

title: HC clears return: Russian woman in Gokarna cave allowed to go home; travel docs issued
description: The Karnataka High Court has allowed the central government to issue travel documents for an overstaying Russian woman, Nina Kutina, and her two minor daughters to return to Russia. The family was found living in an isolated cave near Gokarna.

title: 'If destroyed runways look ... ': India's sharp rebuttal to Shehbaz at UN; asks Pak to handover terrorists
description: India strongly countered Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif's UN remarks, where he claimed Pakistan downed Indian jets and praised Trump for a ceasefire. India's UN representative, Petal Gahlot, refuted this, stating "Operation Sindoor" was an Indian action against terrorists in Pakistan and that Pakistan had pleaded for a ceasefire after threatening more attacks.

title: 'I told him ...': Suryakumar opens up on why Arshdeep Singh bowled Super Over
description: India secured a thrilling Super Over victory against Sri Lanka in their final Asia Cup Super Four match, with captain Suryakumar Yadav praising Sanju Samson, Tilak Varma, and Arshdeep Singh's decisive bowling. Despite Pathum Nissanka's century for Sri Lanka, India remained unbeaten, advancing to the final after a high-scoring contest that went down to the wire.

title: Felt like a final, Arshdeep was always my choice for Super Over: Surya
description: The skipper also lauded the batting effort, which lifted India to 202 for five after being put in. Abhishek Sharma (61), Tilak Varma (49 not out) and Sanju Samson (39) all made key contributions

title: Who was Makena White? Star PGA Golfer Jake Knapp’s GF tragically dies at 28
description: Makena White, girlfriend of PGA golfer Jake Knapp, has died  earlier this week, at age 28. A beautiful person inside out, White lived  a life that was fulfilling. Described as having a "huge heart" and a "rare way of making you feel special," White was a devoted daughter, avid traveler, and dog lover. Her last social media post expressed deep love and pride for Knapp. Here's everything you need to know about Makena White.

title: ‘Followed into bathroom, recorded’: Trump official assaulted at UNGA
description: A Trump administration official faced a physical assault at the United Nations. The incident happened during the UN General Assembly. A "deranged leftist" reportedly attacked the Department of Health and Human Services official. The assailant followed the official into a bathroom. The person was arrested and later released. The US Secret Service will investigate security lapses.

Johnny Manziel admits blowing his NFL shot with the Cleveland Browns
description: Johnny Manziel, once the celebrated Heisman-winning quarterback for Texas A&M and a Cleveland Browns first-round pick, saw his NFL career collapse due to off-field issues, substance abuse, and mental health struggles. Opening up in Untold and Special Forces, he reflects on lost opportunities, personal demons, and his ongoing journey to rebuild, finding solace in golf and self-improvement.

title: Could roses help heal diabetic wounds? A new research paper finds out
description: Researchers from Shiv Nadar University, Delhi-NCR and IIT Bhilai have developed a hydrogel enriched with rose-derived extracellular vesicles and carbon dots, which has shown promise in treating diabetic wounds; if successful, this could be a cost-effective treatment for a growing health burden

title: Tech CEO blasts H-1B fee jump: $100K helps Big Tech; kills startup hiring
description: Box CEO Aaron Levie has strongly criticised President Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, warning it grants large tech companies an unfair advantage over cash-strapped startups in the global talent acquisition race. Levie argued the steep cost transforms international hiring into a 'spending game' smaller firms cannot win, potentially pushing innovation overseas. He advocated for a significantly lower $20,000 fee and a broader reform framework with flexible visa caps, aiming to attract top global talent while safeguarding American wages.

title: High-speed crash in Gurgaon: Five killed as Thar flips after hitting divider
description: Five occupants, including three females, died when their black Thar crashed into a divider and overturned near Jharsa chowk in Gurgaon early Saturday morning. The driver reportedly lost control due to high speed while traveling from Delhi to Gurgaon. All victims were declared dead at a local hospital following the tragic accident.

'285 Bitcoins worth Rs 150cr': ED files chargesheet against Raj Kundra in Crypto scam
description: The Enforcement Directorate has charged businessman Raj Kundra, accusing him of being the beneficial owner of 285 Bitcoins, worth Rs 150.47 crore, received from crypto-scam mastermind Amit Bhardwaj. Kundra allegedly concealed evidence, failed to surrender the Bitcoins, and conducted a below-market transaction with his wife to disguise criminal proceeds, despite a mining deal not materializing.

title: Historic! Sanju Samson breaks Dhoni’s record for most T20I sixes
description: Sanju Samson has now become India's leading T20I wicketkeeper in terms of sixes, surpassing MS Dhoni's record with 55 maximums. Despite adapting to different batting positions, he showcased his destructive power, contributing a vital 39 runs against Sri Lanka. His consistent ability to clear boundaries and adaptability make him a crucial asset for India's upcoming Asia Cup final.

title: Kai Trump shines at Ryder Cup 2025; walks with grandfather Donald Trump
description: President Donald Trump made a high-profile appearance at the 2025 Ryder Cup, joined by his 18-year-old granddaughter, Kai Trump. Their joint outing, from the White House to Bethpage Black, drew immense attention, highlighting Kai's rising golf profile and the family's deep ties to the sport. Trump also injected his trademark bravado.

title: Google celebrates its 27th birthday with a touch of nostalgia
description: Google marked its 27th birthday on September 27, 2025, with a Google Doodle. The company started as a startup in 1998, founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin. It developed into a technology leader. Its services, including Search and Maps, became part of life. The birthday celebration highlighted its journey and future innovations, including AI.

title: Protests over ‘I Love Muhammad’ posters turn violent in Bareilly; 50 detained
description: Bareilly witnessed violent protests after Friday prayers over 'I Love Muhammad' posters, as over 1,000 people pelted stones at police and vandalised vehicles. Police responded with lathi charge and tear gas, injuring ten cops. Fifty individuals, including IMC chief Maulana Tauqeer Raza Khan, were detained. The unrest, sparked by an FIR in Kanpur, led to similar demonstrations across other states.

title: '18 accounts, 28 FD's': Court dismisses anticipatory bail plea of godman for fraud
description: A Delhi court denied anticipatory bail to Chaitanyananda Saraswati, alias Parthasarathy, who faces charges of cheating, forgery, and sexual harassment. The former institute director is accused of misappropriating funds, forging documents for two passports with differing identities, and fabricating records. Police froze Rs 8 crore as he remains at large, requiring custodial interrogation.

description: Ward 143 councillor V. Rajan said the bridge replaced a low-level causeway that was always inundated during rain, disrupting traffic.

title: H3N2 flu cases rise in Delhi, doctors urge precaution
Asia Cup: Injury scare for India? Bowling coach shares updates on Abhishek Sharma, Pandya
description: India had an injury scare as Hardik Pandya and Abhishek Sharma left the field during the Sri Lanka clash, but bowling coach Morne Morkel confirmed both suffered only cramps. While Hardik will be reassessed before the Pakistan final, Abhishek is fit. Morkel admitted India haven’t played a “complete game” yet and stressed sharper execution across departments.

title: Travis Kelce rumoured to star in Taylor Swift’s 'The Fate of Ophelia' video
description: Taylor Swift fans are speculating Travis Kelce will appear in her "The Fate of Ophelia" music video, fueled by a lip-read comment from a behind-the-scenes clip. Theories suggest Swift wants "him" in the video, potentially rewriting Ophelia's tragic story to incorporate her real-life romance. The highly anticipated video premieres October 3.

title: Delhi govt to waive 100% late fee on water bills — how you can benefit

description: U.S. Special Envoy Steve Witkoff said U.S. Predsident Trump presented proposals to those leaders that included a 21-point Middle East peace plan

Body-shaming, leering gaze: DU fact-finding body found sufficient basis for sexual harassment allegations against college principal
Asia Cup: 'If anyone speaks against India, I will...'- Yograj Singh warns Pak ahead of final
description: Former India pacer Yograj Singh strongly condemned the on-field spat between Indian and Pakistani players during the Asia Cup Super Fours. He fiercely defended young Indian batters Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill, blaming Pakistan pacers for initiating verbal abuse. Singh's comments intensify the already charged rivalry ahead of the Asia Cup final.

title: J&K L-G Manoj Sinha announces re-opening of 12 tourist spots closed after Pahalgam attack
description: An official said out of 12 tourist spots thrown open, five are in the Jammu division and seven in the Kashmir division.

description: CM Mann noted that contributions through Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) could not be made to the Chief Minister's Relief Fund, and even Members of Parliament can donate a maximum of 20 lakh to it.

FIFA suspends seven Malaysian players over forged documents
description: World football's disciplinary committee imposed the sanctions after the Football Association of Malaysia (FAM) doctored documentation to be able to field the players in a 4-0 win over Vietnam in June, it said in a statement.

title: Epstein files: Musk appears in newly released papers; possible island visit in 2014
description: Elon Musk's name appeared in the Jeffrey Epstein files. Other prominent figures like Prince Andrew and Peter Thiel are also mentioned. Democratic lawmakers released these documents. They show possible interactions between Epstein and these individuals. Musk may have visited Epstein's island in 2014. This was after Epstein was a registered sex offender. The revelations raise new questions.

‘We have sharp eyes’: Gurgaon cop stalks digital creator using her car number
description: A Gurgaon police constable was suspended and an FIR registered after he used official channels to trace a 50-year-old digital creator's car registration. Finding her "attractive," he tracked her Instagram, commenting on her movements and admitting his identity, deeply disturbing the woman who later filed a complaint. Police took action after her video went viral.

title: In rare rebuke, federal officials discipline ICE officer for shoving woman in New York
description: The altercation, which was captured on videos that spread quickly on social media, unfolded after the woman's husband was arrested at an immigration court in New York City

title: Giving warriors a fighting chance: Where personnel injured in line of duty are trained to become para-athletes and IT professionals
description: In 2020, the National Centre for Divyang Empowerment was established as an exclusive facility for training CAPF personnel who suffer injuries and become physically challenged in the line of duty. In five years, the centre has trained 219 ‘Divyang warriors’, producing medal-winning para-athletes and IT professionals. Vijaita Singh and Naveen Kumar report on how the facilities on campus give the injured a new lease of life

title: Ukraine says Russia drone incursion part of pressure plan against West
description: Russia denies it planned to target anything in Poland with drones as it was attacking neighbouring Ukraine.

title: Two Kerala students allege assault by Delhi police personnel
description: Denying allegations of theft, they say police officers brutally assaulted them, forced them to speak in Hindi and ridiculed them for wearing lungi; MP John Brittas seeks impartial probe into ‘custodial brutality’

title: 'Slapped, uniform torn': Delhi traffic cop assaulted by group for stopping helmetless duo
description: A traffic police sub-inspector was assaulted by a group of men in north Delhi after stopping them for a helmet check. Four individuals have been arrested, with two confessing to inciting the crowd by falsely alleging communal remarks. The officer sustained injuries, and police are searching for other suspects involved in the attack.

title: 'Man of peace': At UNGA, Sharif backs Trump's claim of mediation
description: Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif delivered a bizarre UN speech, falsely claiming victory over India and praising Trump for a ceasefire. Meanwhile, Trump's new 100% tariff on imported branded drugs has unsettled markets, raising concerns for India's $10bn pharma exports, especially if branded generics are included, prompting a search for new markets.

title: Federal agents fire chemicals as protesters try to block car at immigration site outside Chicago
description: Agents repeatedly fired chemical agents toward a crowd of over 100 protesters after some of the group attempted to block a car from driving down a street toward the ICE building on Friday

India rejects as baseless Nato chief's claim PM Modi quizzed Putin on war
description: MEA strongly refuted Nato chief Mark Rutte's claims that PM Modi questioned Russian President Putin about his Ukraine strategy due to US tariffs. The MEA asserted no such conversation occurred, urging Nato for greater accuracy in public statements. India continues its discounted Russian oil imports, defending them as vital for national economic security.

title: Tehran, Moscow sign $25 billion deal to build nuclear plants in Iran
description: Iran has just one operational nuclear power plant in Bushehr in the south, with a capacity of 1,000 megawatts — just a fraction of the country's energy needs

title: After Operation Sindoor, LeT moves deep into Pakistan
description: UN-designated terror outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba is relocating its operational and training infrastructure deeper into Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa to evade Indian strikes. Satellite imagery confirms a new facility, Markaz Jihad-e-Aqsa, is under construction in Lower Dir, 47km from the Afghan border, replacing a hub destroyed by the Indian Army. Key masterminds have been assigned leadership and instructional roles at this new site.

This follows IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw's adoption of Zoho's Swadeshi platform, urging others to embrace indigenous products. Vembu thanked the minister, boosting his team's morale.

Indian study permits in Canada drop 50%; implications for education sector & economy
description: Canada has seen a 50% decline in Indian study permit approvals in 2025, with projections suggesting a 67.5% drop from 2023. The number of new student arrivals and total permit holders has also decreased sharply. According to ICEF Monitor, this trend stems from stricter immigration policies, economic pressures, and rising global competition. The downturn could lead to a $10.5 billion shortfall in economic contributions, severely affecting Canadian education institutions and provincial economies.

All isn't well with how Sonam Wangchuk's career has gone
description: Sonam Wangchuk, the inspiration for the '3 Idiots' protagonist, has emerged as a prominent political activist for Ladakh. He has undertaken multiple hunger strikes, demanding statehood and Sixth Schedule protection for the region's indigenous people, citing concerns over resource exploitation post-Article 370 abrogation. His latest fast concluded after violent protests erupted across the region.

Accenture fired 11,000+ employees; CEO Julie Sweet warns, exit or upgrade
description: Accenture laid off over 11,000 employees globally in three months, citing rapid AI adoption and slowing corporate demand. These cuts are part of an $865 million restructuring, with more exits anticipated as the company aligns its workforce with AI-driven solutions and invests in agentic AI training. Despite the layoffs, Accenture reported a 7% revenue increase.

title: Kirk’s past attacks on Taylor Swift resurface after his death
description: Following Charlie Kirk's death, his old derogatory post targeting Taylor Swift has resurfaced. In 2018, Kirk criticized Swift for endorsing a Democrat and questioning Marsha Blackburn's stance on women's issues. Swift had openly opposed Blackburn's views on LGBTQ+ rights and women's rights. The resurfaced post has drawn attention amid the controversy surrounding Kirk's assassination.
